column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of Ni- (en)3Ag2I4 and Zn(en)3Ag2I4 were achieved using the published method23,24,26 and labeled as ZnNi-I and ZnNiVII, respectively.
#Text=Each polycrystalline sample of solid solution was prepared using the same process, which is also similar to the preparation for Ni(en)3Ag2I4 and Zn(en)3Ag2I4.
#Text=The difference in the process of preparing each solid solution sample only concerns the relative content of Zn2+ to Ni2+ ions in the starting DMF solution containing Zn(NO3)2 and Ni(NO3)2.

#Text=In the starting DMF solution, the total concentration of Zn2+ and Ni2+ ions was maintained at 0.15 mol L−1 and the molar ratio of Zn(NO3)2 and Ni(NO3)2 is x/(1 − x) for each solid solution sample (x = 0.1, 0.3, 0.5, 0.7, and 0.9), and the corresponding solid solution sample is labeled as ZnNi-II, ZnNi-III, ZnNi-IV, ZnNi-V, and ZnNi-VI, respectively
